column4: yo' fellows I need some support uninstalling freeNX server /or maybe NXserver from computer and installing-it back on .....problem is I was running dpkg -r but the system reports the server is still running ?1?!?!
broken prerm-script. sudo killall nxserver     or however the process is called
no process found . . .
ps aux |grep -i nx
ID 2088 ..when doing killall - no process found
sudo killall 2088
err: sudo kill 2088
no process found .....I think is a ghost process or so ....
kill: no such process
pgrep nx
I have a bigger problem I think I've installes nxserver and freeNX both together ...now the situation is messy :d
http://pastebin.com/w2NDZZvw - could you please check this ?
sry i don't use nx and cannot help you with that
Ok but how should I uninstall that packages ??
aptitude purge '~nfreenx' nx-common nxagent nxlibs
it will work even if not installed through aptitude ???
yes, aptitude is just another frontend to apt
yes but if they were installed by dpkg ????
shouldn't matter
or by configuration scripts ???
it seems to work ...no more server reporting to run .....
check routeing "route -n", your defalut-route should point to the vpn-servers IP
the command is giving me the external IP of the VPN server ...and also an internal IP address ...guess that's correct
